name: NFDI4Health_LM_MDS_Design
title: NFDI4Health LM MDS Module Design V3.3
description: NFDI4Health Logical Model MDS Module Design V3.3

element.short: NFDI4Health LM MDS Module Design V3.3
element.definition: NFDI4Health Logical Model MDS Module Design V3.3
**Description: **Group of items providing information about the characteristics of a [RESOURCE].
element.comment: Additional information: Group of items applicable only to studies, substudies, registries, and secondary data sources.

element.definition: **Description: **Non-interventional design refers to a [RESOURCE] that does not aim to alter its outcomes of interest. Interventional design refers to a [RESOURCE] that aims to alter its outcomes of interest.
**Description: **Group of items providing information about the type of the [RESOURCE].
**Description: **The strategy for assigning interventions to participants.
**Description: **The primary strategy for participant identification and follow-up.
**Description: **Group of items providing information about primary health condition(s) or disease(s) considered in the [RESOURCE].
**Description: **Name of primary health condition or disease considered in the [RESOURCE].
element.comment: Additional information: The use of terms from established terminologies/classifications (e.g. SNOMED CT, ICD, etc.) is preferred. However, also self-assigned terms are allowed.

element.definition: **Description: **Terminology/classification used for the health condition or disease.
**Description: **Code of the health condition or disease in the terminology/classification used.
**Description:** Group of items providing information about the focus of the [RESOURCE] (e.g. medication, food, therapy, device, etc.).
**Description:** Focus area of the [RESOURCE] (e.g. medication, food, therapy, device, etc.).
element.comment: Additional information: The use of terms from established terminologies/classifications (e.g. SNOMED CT, ICD, etc.) is preferred. However, also self-assigned terms are allowed.

element.definition: **Description:** Terminology/classification used for the focus area.
**Description:** Code of the focus area in the terminology/classification used.
**Description: **Group of items providing information about groups of diseases or conditions on which the data were collected in the [RESOURCE].
**Description: **General groups of diseases or conditions on which the data were collected in the [RESOURCE].
element.comment: Additional information: The values originate from the WHO's International Statistical Classification of Diseases and Related Health Problems, 10th Revision (ICD-10).

element.definition: **Description: **Diseases or conditions on which the data were collected in the [RESOURCE].
element.comment: Additional information: The values originate from the WHO's International Statistical Classification of Diseases and Related Health Problems, 10th Revision (ICD-10).

element.definition: **Description: **Indication whether mortality data are collected in the [RESOURCE].
**Description:** Group of items providing administrative information about the [RESOURCE].
**Description: **Status of the [RESOURCE] approval from the (leading) ethics committee.
**Description: **Overall status of the [RESOURCE].
element.comment: Additional information: If at least one [RESOURCE] site in a multicenter [RESOURCE] has the status 'Ongoing', then the overall status of the [RESOURCE] must be 'Ongoing'.

element.definition: **Description: **Specification whether [RESOURCE] participants receive an intervention or have completed it but are still being followed up according to the primary objective of the [RESOURCE].
**Description: **Specification of the stage at which the [RESOURCE] was prematurely stopped.
**Description: **Specification of the reason(s) why the [RESOURCE] was prematurely stopped.
**Description: **Specification whether [RESOURCE] participants are selected from a predetermined population.
**Description: **Overall recruitment status of the [RESOURCE] as indicated in the corresponding register of clinical trials.
element.comment: Additional information: The item applies only to studies automatically uploaded from the registers of clinical trials.

element.definition: **Description: **Start date of data collection for the [RESOURCE].

**Description:** In case of a [RESOURCE] with patients or other participants, it is the date when the last participant is examined or receives an intervention, or the date of the last participant’s last visit.
**Description: **Country or countries where the [RESOURCE] takes place.
**Description: **If applicable, region(s) and/or city(ies) within a country where the [RESOURCE] takes place.
**Description: **Specification whether the [RESOURCE] is conducted at only one or at more than one [RESOURCE] center.
**Description: **Number of centers involved in the [RESOURCE].
**Description:** Specification whether the [RESOURCE] involves only one or more than one data provider.
**Description:** Number of data providers involved in the [RESOURCE].
**Description: **The primary subject addressed by the [RESOURCE], i.e. a person, an animal or other subject types.
**Description: **Group of items providing information about the applied sampling method.
**Description: **Type of the sampling method applied for the selection of [RESOURCE] participants.
**Description: **Specific type of the probability sampling method applied for the selection of [RESOURCE] participants.
**Description: **Specific type of the non-probability sampling method applied for the selection of [RESOURCE] participants.
**Description: **Group of items providing information about data sources from which the data of the [RESOURCE] are generated or extracted.
**Description: **Different types of data sources from which the data of the [RESOURCE] are generated or extracted.
**Description: **Specification of biosamples collected in the [RESOURCE].
**Description: **Specification of imaging data collected in the [RESOURCE].
**Description: **Specification of omics technology applied in the [RESOURCE].

**Description: **If needed, additional descriptive information about the data sources of the [RESOURCE], e.g. indication of the data source(s) not listed in the field 'Type(s) of data sources' or a more detailed description of the selected data sources.
**Description: **Specification of the main purpose of the [RESOURCE].
element.comment: Additional information: The field is defined foremost for interventional studies. For non-interventional studies, this field may not be applicable as diverse purposes may be pursued without being able to specify a primary one. In this case, the option 'Not applicable' can be selected.

element.definition: **Description: **Group of items providing information about eligibility criteria for [RESOURCE] participants.
**Description: **Group of items providing information about the minimum eligible age of [RESOURCE] participants.
**Description: **Numerical value of the minimum age of potential participants eligible to participate in the [RESOURCE].
element.comment: Additional information: In the case of cohort studies, further participant ages can be indicated in the fields 'Inclusion criteria' or 'Exclusion criteria'.

element.definition: **Description: **Unit of measurement used to describe the minimum eligible age.
**Description: **Group of items providing information about the maximum eligible age of [RESOURCE] participants.
**Description: **Numerical value of the maximum age of potential participants eligible to participate in the [RESOURCE].
element.comment: Additional information: In the case of cohort studies, further participant ages can be indicated in the fields 'Inclusion criteria' or 'Exclusion criteria'.

element.definition: **Description: **Unit of measurement used to describe the maximum eligible age.
**Description: **Gender of potential participants eligible to participate in the [RESOURCE].
**Description: **Inclusion criteria for participation in the [RESOURCE].

example.label: example 1
example.valueString: - First inclusion criterion; - Second inclusion criterion;

element.definition: **Description: **Exclusion criteria for participation in the [RESOURCE].

example.label: example 1
example.valueString: - First inclusion criterion; - Second inclusion criterion;

element.definition: **Description:** Group of items providing information about the population of the [RESOURCE].
**Description:** Specification of the recruitment area of the [RESOURCE].
**Description: **Additional descriptive information providing more details about the population of the [RESOURCE].
**Description: **Intended number of observational units for the whole [RESOURCE] (e.g. intended number of [RESOURCE] participants at all sites of the [RESOURCE]).
**Description: **Obtained number of observational units for the whole [RESOURCE] (e.g. obtained number of [RESOURCE] participants at all sites of the [RESOURCE]).
element.comment: Additional information: The value is only available after the end of recruitment.

element.definition: **Description: **Group of items providing information about the actual minimum age of study participants at the time of examination.
**Description: **Numerical value of the minimum age of study participants at the time of examination.
**Description: **Unit of time.
**Description: **Group of items providing information about the actual maximum age of study participants at the time of examination.
**Description: **Numerical value of the maximum age of study participants at the time of examination.
**Description: **Unit of time.
**Description: **Statement of the research questions and/or hypotheses underlying the [RESOURCE].
**Description: **Group of items providing information about the arms of the [RESOURCE].
**Description: **Short name used to identify the arm.
element.comment: Additional information: 'Arm' means a pre-specified group or subgroup of participants in the [RESOURCE] assigned to receive specific intervention(s) (or no intervention) according to a protocol.

element.definition: **Description: **Role of the given arm in the [RESOURCE].
**Description: **Additional descriptive information about the given arm.
element.comment: Additional information: If needed, additional descriptive information (including which interventions are administered in each arm) to differentiate each arm from other arms in the [RESOURCE].

element.definition: **Description:** Group of items providing information about the groups/cohorts of the [RESOURCE].
**Description:** Short name used to identify the group.
element.comment: Additional information: 'Group' means a predefined group (cohort) of participants to be studied.

element.definition: **Description:** Additional descriptive information about the given group.
element.comment: Additional information: Explanation of the nature of the [RESOURCE] group (for example, participants with and without a condition, participants with and without an exposure, etc.).

element.definition: **Description: **Group of items providing information about the interventions of the [RESOURCE].
element.comment: Additional information: Specification of the intervention(s) associated with each arm.

element.definition: **Description: **A short descriptive name of the intervention.
**Description: **General type of the given intervention.
**Description: **If needed, additional descriptive information about the given intervention.
**Description: **Name(s) of the [RESOURCE] arm(s) associated with the given intervention.
**Description:** Group of items providing information about the exposures of the [RESOURCE].
element.comment: Additional information: Specification of the exposure(s) associated with each group.

element.definition: **Description:** A short descriptive name of the exposure.
**Description:** General type of the given exposure.
**Description:** If needed, additional descriptive information about the given exposure.
**Description:** Name(s) of the [RESOURCE] group(s) associated with the given exposure.
**Description: **Group of items providing information about outcome measures.
element.comment: Additional information: he items are optional, especially for non-interventional studies.

element.definition: **Description: **The type indicates the degree of importance of the outcome measure in the [RESOURCE].

**Description: **Name of the outcome measure.
For non-interventional studies, this can be the name of specific measurement(s) or observation(s) used to describe patterns of diseases or traits or associations with exposures, risk factors or treatment.
**Description: **Additional descriptive information about the given outcome.
**Description: **Description of the time point(s) at which the measurement for the outcome is assessed, e.g. the specific duration of time over which each participant is assessed.
**Description: **Any additional information about specific aspects of the [RESOURCE] that could not be captured by other fields.
**Description: **Any additional assessments/measurements included in the [RESOURCE].
**Description: **Group of items providing information about the data sharing strategy of the [RESOURCE].

**Description: **Indication whether there is a plan to make data collected in the [RESOURCE] available. In case of a [RESOURCE] with patients or other individuals, this refers to individual participant data (IPD).
**Description: **Supporting information/documents which will be made available in addition to the data collected in the [RESOURCE].
**Description: **Indication of the time period for which the data and, if applicable, supporting documents will be made available.
**Description: **Indication of the access criteria by which the data will be shared, including: a) with whom; b) for which types of analyses; and c) by what mechanism.

**Description: **Additional descriptive information providing more details about data sharing, e.g. indication of which data in particular will be shared or why the data will not be shared or why it is not yet decided.
**Description: **Indication whether the DataSHIELD/Opal infrastructure is available.
**Description:** If existing, a link to the web page where the data request form and/or information on data reuse can be found.
**Description: **If existing, a link to the web page where additional information about data sharing can be found.
**Description:** Indication if record linkage with other data sources is possible.
element.comment: Additional information: Record linkage refers to the merging of data on the same person from different databases.

element.definition: **Description: **Group of items providing information about specific non-interventional aspects of the [RESOURCE].
element.comment: Additional information: Group of items applicable only to non-interventional resources.

element.definition: **Description: **Temporal design of the [RESOURCE], i.e. the observation period in relation to the time of participant enrollment.
**Description:** If applicable, anticipated time period over which each participant would be followed.
**Description:** Numerical value of the target follow-up duration.
**Description:** Unit of measurement used to describe the follow-up duration.
**Description:** The number of follow-ups conducted within the specified duration.
**Description: **If applicable, anticipated time period over which each participant is to be followed, provided in years.
**Description: **Indication whether samples of biomaterials from participants of the [RESOURCE] are retained in a biorepository.
**Description: **Additional information about retained biosamples, i.e. an indication of the specific types of retained biospecimens (e.g. blood, serum, urine, etc.).
**Description: **Group of items providing information about specific interventional aspects of the [RESOURCE].
element.comment: Additional information: Group of items applicable only to interventional resources.

element.definition: **Description: **If applicable, numerical phase of the [RESOURCE].
**Description: **Group of items providing information about the masking of intervention(s) assignment.

**Description: **Indication whether a masking (or blinding) of intervention(s) assignment is implemented (i.e., whether someone is prevented from having knowledge of the interventions assigned to individual participants).
**Description: **If masking is implemented, the party(ies) who are masked.
**Description: **If needed, additional descriptive information about masking (e.g. information about other parties who may be masked).
**Description: **Type of allocation/assignment of individual participants of the [RESOURCE] to an arm.
**Description: **Unapproved (off-label) use of a drug product.
**Description: **Group of items providing information about provenance aspects of the data entry on the portal.
**Description: **Source of information about the resource and the way it was uploaded/collected.
**Description: **Date on which the responsible party last verified the information about the resource, even if no additional or updated information is being submitted.
**Description: **User who last verified the information about the resource.
**Description: **Date when the resource was first submitted for publication.
**Description: **User who first submitted the [RESOURCE] for publication.
**Description: **Date when the resource was first posted/published.
**Description: **User who first posted/published the resource.
**Description: **Date when the last update of the resource was submitted for publication.
**Description: **User who submitted the last update of the resource.
**Description: **Date when the last update of the resource was posted/published.
**Description: **User who posted/published the last update.
**Description: **Version number of the resource within the portal/system.
